title: Manchester
summary: Manchester (/ˈmæntʃɪstər, -tʃɛs-/)[4][5] is a city and metropolitan borough in Greater Manchester, England. The city has the country's fifth-largest population at 547,627 (as of 2018)[6] and lies within the United Kingdom's second-most populous urban area, with a population of 2.7 million,[7] third most-populous county, at around 2.8 million.[8] It is fringed by the Cheshire Plain to the south, the Pennines to the north and east, and an arc of towns with which it forms a continuous conurbation.[9] The local authority for the city is Manchester City Council.
